messages.subject: Re: Feel Free:)
messages.msgSnippet: ... with? I ve been putting books on hold from my library  :) I actually got four today..the others were: The Edison Trait-Saving the  spirit of your
messages.messageBody:
> Jann,
>
> Haven't read any by John Holt, yet. Which title should I start
with? I've been putting books on hold from my library :) I actually
got four today..the others were: "The Edison Trait-Saving the spirit
of your non-conforming Child" and "Dreamers, discoverers &
dynamos : how to help the child who is bright, bored...".both by Lucy
Jo Palladino, PH.D.; "Raising Your Spirited Child"by Mary Sheedy
Kurcinka. Got alot of reading to do LOL>>>>

I've read them all (and more!)! I started with Raising your
spirited child back when my dd was younger, before I even considered
homeschooling. ANYTHING by Holt is good (How children Learn, How
children fail, Learning all the Time). Google him and you'll find
stuff too. My books are still in boxes (although I DID find them
earlier! I need to get them out, I MISS THEM!). Once I get them
out, I'm going to make a LIST in word so I can pass it on!
Jann




>
> Rachael~
>
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Re: Feel Free:)
messages.msgSnippet: Jann, Haven t read any by John Holt, yet.  Which title should I start with? I ve been putting books on hold from my library  :) I actually got four today..the
messages.messageBody:
Jann,

Haven't read any by John Holt, yet. Which title should I start with? I've
been putting books on hold from my library :) I actually got four today..the
others were: "The Edison Trait-Saving the spirit of your non-conforming Child"
and "Dreamers, discoverers & dynamos : how to help the child who is
bright, bored...".both by Lucy Jo Palladino, PH.D.; "Raising Your Spirited
Child"by Mary Sheedy Kurcinka. Got alot of reading to do LOL

Rachael~

messages.subject: Re: Feel Free:)
messages.msgSnippet: ... and principal. The moment I mailed out the letters I felt a weight lifted...i feel so free! Yippee! ... Compulsory Schooling by John Taylor Gatto.
messages.messageBody:
> So today I sent out a letter of intent to HS to the superintendant
and principal. The moment I mailed out the letters I felt a weight
lifted...i feel so free!>>>

Yippee!

>> I've just started reading,"Dumbing Us Down-The Hidden Curriculum of
Compulsory Schooling" by John Taylor Gatto.>>>>

I love John Taylor Gatto, and this book was one of the first ones I
read that really changed how I look at public education. Keep us
posted about what you think! Have you read any John Holt yet?
Awesome stuff as well. There are so many great books....
Jann

messages.subject: Feel Free:)
messages.msgSnippet: Hi all :) So today I sent out a letter of intent to HS to the superintendant and principal. The moment I mailed out the letters I felt a weight lifted...i feel
messages.messageBody:
Hi all :)

So today I sent out a letter of intent to HS to the superintendant and
principal. The moment I mailed out the letters I felt a weight
lifted...i feel so free! I've just started reading,"Dumbing Us Down-The
Hidden Curriculum of Compulsory Schooling" by John Taylor Gatto. Still
waiting for the Unschooling book I put on hold on the library. Jio was
thrilled to hear he would be able to stay home :) He spent his day
playing video games and computer games.


Rachael~
